description: Supports SAML sign-in for Amazon Connect. Retrieves a token for federation. The token is for the Amazon Connect user which corresponds to the IAM credentials that were used to invoke this action. For more information about how SAML sign-in works in Amazon Connect, see Configure SAML with IAM for Amazon Connect in the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instance ID in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance.

nested_items.name: Credentials
nested_items.description: The credentials to use for federation.

nested_items.name: AccessToken
nested_items.description: An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon Connect.

nested_items.name: AccessTokenExpiration
nested_items.description: A token generated with an expiration time for the session a user is logged in to Amazon Connect.

nested_items.name: RefreshToken
nested_items.description: Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect instance.

nested_items.name: RefreshTokenExpiration
nested_items.description: Renews the expiration timer for a generated token.

nested_items.name: SignInUrl
nested_items.description: The URL to sign into the user's instance.

nested_items.name: UserArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user.

nested_items.name: UserId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the user. This can be the ID or the ARN of the user.
